intro: Arisaema umegashimense, commonly known as the Umeagashima arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces an unusual, spiky structure that houses its small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
